greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 1, a(2) = 2, a(n) = smallest positive integer not occurring earlier such that the sum of three successive terms is a square.
link: Ivan Neretin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a = {1, 2}; Do[s = a[[-1]] + a[[-2]]; k = Floor[Sqrt[s]] + 1; While[MemberQ[a, k^2 - s], k++]; AppendTo[a, k^2 - s], {n, 3, 70}]; a (* _Ivan Neretin_, May 25 2015 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Oct 25 2002
